name: Ronaldo Fumio Hashimoto
content: SCoRe Lab - Statistical and Computational Learning Research Laboratory SCoRe Lab Statistical and Computational Learning Research Laboratory Home About Contact Ronaldo Fumio Hashimoto Associate Professor at the Department of Computer Science Institute of Mathematics and Statistics University of São Paulo (USP) São Paulo, Brazil Academic Formation Ronaldo Fumio Hashimoto received a B.Sc. degree in Physics at the Institute of Physics (University of São Paulo, Brazil), a M.Sc. degree in Applied Math. at the Institute of Mathematics and Statistics (University of São Paulo, Brazil) and a Ph.D. degree in Applied Math. at the Institute of Mathematics and Statistics (University of São Paulo, Brazil). He held a post-doc researcher position (from 2001 to 2003) at the Texas A&M University (grant from the National Human Genome Research Institute). He is currently a professor at the DCC - IME - USP. Research Interests Image Processing Computer Vision Mathematical Morphology Bioinformatics Gene Regulatory Networks Probabilistic Boolean Networks Machine Learning Research Work Publications Currículo (CNPq - Lattes) Personal Interests Online LaTeX Editor Overleaf Teaching and Students First Semester of 2008 MAC 2166 - Introdução à Computação para Engenharia ( Turma 07 ) MAC 0329 - Álgebra Booleana e Aplicações Past Semesters Previous Courses Designed by WPThemes.Info Last modified: Tue Mar 11 17:57:28 BRT 2008
